paper_title.en: Energy saving potential of low-impact life style in residential buildings

description.en: The purpose of this study is to make clear the energy saving potential of low-impact life style through the measurementof energy consumptioin in residential buildings. The actions for low-impact life style are "to control the heat loss or heatgain by using curtains and blinds", "to set PC at saving energy mode" and so on. The results are as follows.(1) In one-person households, energy saving of 3.6-44.6% were achieved. Low-impact life style of air conditioning, lighting and information home appliances were effectively practiced.(2) In family households, 50-70% of whole subjects achieved 0.9-14.1% energy saving.

paper_title.en: Estimation of energy consumption in building: Study on energy conservation in apartment house

description.en: Apartment house is given a sizable portion in housing stock in Japan. Improvement of energetic consideration in apartment house can be as a part of principal energy strategy for residential sector as well as existing maintenance and management. In this study, the electric and gas consumption of dwelling unit is derived from the factors of time lag of behaviors based on survey on human activity patterns. In addition, electric consumption of elevator and pump is simulated based on aforementioned time trajectory of usage pattern. Consumption of ligthing in common space is also estimated by the field measurement campaigns. The total energy consumption of standard type in this study is estimated 8127GJ/year. Electric consumption is positioned 68% of total energy consumption. Electric consumption in common space is estimated 1054GJ/year, positioned 21% of total building consumption.

paper_title.en: FEASIBILITY STUDY OF DISTRIBUTED ENERGY SYSTEM FOR APARTEMENT HOUSE

description.ja: Many countries positioned the distributed energy system as a part of principal energy strategy for residential sector. For introduction of distributed energy system, such as co-generation sysytem, to residential sector, the balance between heat and electricity has to be resolved for stable and efficient operation. In this study, a statistical analysis tool is proposed for the estimation of hot water demand using a simple statistical parametric method. The parameters of statistical model proposed in this paper is derived from the factors of time lag of behaviors that based on survey on human activity patterns. The effect of number of household on hot water demand was simulated based on the aforementioned random model. In addition to the simulation study on hot water demand, the change of electricity demand was also studied especially for the time trajectory of usage pattern. The field measurement campaigns were then performed on various common locations of apartment such as lobby and service corridor. In short, the paper discusses the impact of various characteristics of apartment house onto the performance of distributed energy system. To be more precise, several key characteristics were considered such as housing type, housing scale, and width of common space.
description.en: Many countries positioned the distributed energy system as a part of principal energy strategy for residential sector. For introduction of distributed energy system, such as co-generation sysytem, to residential sector, the balance between heat and electricity has to be resolved for stable and efficient operation. In this study, a statistical analysis tool is proposed for the estimation of hot water demand using a simple statistical parametric method. The parameters of statistical model proposed in this paper is derived from the factors of time lag of behaviors that based on survey on human activity patterns. The effect of number of household on hot water demand was simulated based on the aforementioned random model. In addition to the simulation study on hot water demand, the change of electricity demand was also studied especially for the time trajectory of usage pattern. The field measurement campaigns were then performed on various common locations of apartment such as lobby and service corridor. In short, the paper discusses the impact of various characteristics of apartment house onto the performance of distributed energy system. To be more precise, several key characteristics were considered such as housing type, housing scale, and width of common space.

paper_title.ja: ファサードエンジニアリングの統合に関する研究 ―統合ファサードの提案および性能評価―
paper_title.en: STUDIES ON INTEGRATED FACADE ENGINEERING : Proposal for integrated facade and its evaluation

description.ja: Building facade plays an important role for not only creating urban landscape design, but also affecting the environmental impact through energy consumption. Also such perimeter zones are effective area for placing seismic resisting elements in structural design. For satisfying all of these demands, the authors proposed the concept of integrated facade engineering, which treats architectural design, structural and environmental design combined together. Following the previous paper, detailed examples of "Integrated Facade" are proposed in this paper, and their performances in each axis are evaluated.
description.en: Building facade plays an important role for not only creating urban landscape design, but also affecting the environmental impact through energy consumption. Also such perimeter zones are effective area for placing seismic resisting elements in structural design. For satisfying all of these demands, the authors proposed the concept of integrated facade engineering, which treats architectural design, structural and environmental design combined together. Following the previous paper, detailed examples of "Integrated Facade" are proposed in this paper, and their performances in each axis are evaluated.
